item.title: Blood sprinkles on pavement, 28th August
item.description:
Someone on Tuesday night has left sprinkler or many dots the size a small tea spoon on the pavement. It looks very unhygienic and very troubling be it could be contaminated and kids often drop toys on the street and pick it up with out looking. Please get someone to clean it with some powerful solution cleaner. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southampton Way, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag causing obsruction opp McDonalds in James Watt Way, 28th August
item.description:
About an hour ago we went to Morrisons in Erith. We have to drive past the flags as mentioned in above email, The flag opposite Erith Macdonald's has slid down the pole, ie the one ext to the traffic lights at that junction The flag is one of the largest I have seen, actually close to 2 meters in length and about 1.3 meters depth It is hanging like a big towel on a door hook and about 9 feet off the grounds as it cannot slide down any further because of the shape of the lamppost On the way back home I noted it was flying ito the face of a pedestrian crossing the road at that spot as These traffic lights incorporate a pedestrian crossing controlled with traffic lights The same fla is now not only a danger to the safety of pedestrians but traffic as well. At the very least this flag needs to be taken down or put up correctly if the council has approved it Thank you (I will keep an eye on it and see what you have done - i did not take a picture as i was driving To be clear, this is not a foolish attempt to get all flags down that is left to you the council but an honest and sincere update Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): James Watt Way, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
